bibl.title: Despatch from Emory H. Taunt to W.F. Wharton, November 10, 1889
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

body.div1:
Commercial Agency of the United States Boma Nov. 10th, 1889 (Written En Route)
Mr. E.H.Taunt TO THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE
Subject: Processing to Port
ABSTRACT OF CONTENTS: Rerouting disstants as regards Whartons about as regard from of work on arrival at Boma
<pb facs="20170614_135823"
Honorable W.H. Wharton Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D.C.
Sir:
I have the honor to inform the Department that the Tulak Steamer did not soil as was intended and I was obliged to take the Liverpool Steamer Which after a postpondment of ten days finally carried. In nice honors arrive within the 90 days allowed it for hunnits. As this vessel powered direct to Boma--
I have, by order of the Authorities of the State, purchased a quantity of posses? for myself as personal curfit for further use as the New Upper Congo. As on account of
<pb facs="20170614_135920"
the large mission of the white foundation incident to the building of the railroad and the starting of the new coupausie mentioned in my despatch no 12. (Reform an Larren Congo). The State cannot give us food lodging or so as I had hoped but can only furnish us riverport on steamer and an armed force when necessary
I would be under to start for the Upper Congo with less than six hundred suffice and I have been obliged to avail myself of the permission granted by the Department and *drm in ordance upon the Desposition in order to start well Ruff
I hope to start for the Upper Congo shortly after my arrival at Boma and before the West reason for well demands, Pure me
<pb facs="20170614_1400010"
repeat
<pb facs="20170614_140025"
the small rivers are serousen here is different is both difficult and zuhearthy.
I would also mention that porters are now paid in gold. And I am informed the prior has greatly increased in six months.
I am told that some gentlemen intended in the Congo Wood. With to increase the appreciation for Efesuds as regard wars on the Upper Congo --so that it can be continued, and furnished. Without writing for each yearly appropriation to become honorable.
Shared this matter be Dachted I hope the Department Nice forwardly consider it and endorse it for it will greatly facilate in and work, Hurry that an answer assortation for my
<pb facs="20170614_140048"
necessary difference was assured. I am Sir: Very Respectfully E.H.Taunt U.S. Com. Agt. Boma
